Package etithespirit.orimod.lighttech

Class Assembly

java.lang.Object
etithespirit.orimod.lighttech.Assembly
public final class Assembly extends Object
Represents an arbitrary, scalable layout of connected objects that may have loops and/or forks. It is composed of any number of Lines.

  • Field Summary

  • Field Details

    • world

      public final net.minecraft.world.level.Level world
      The Level this Assembly exists in.

    • _id

      @NotNetworkReplicated public final int _id
      An ID for debugging this assembly. This is for use in clientside rendering.

    • assemblyId

      public final UUID assemblyId
      A synchronized unique identifier for this assembly that is safe for network replication.

  • Method Details

    • getAssemblyFor

      @Nonnull public static Assembly getAssemblyFor(AbstractLightEnergyHub hub)
      Returns a new assembly for the given AbstractLightEnergyHub, or if another assembly already has this as one of its roots, returns that other assembly.
      Parameters:
      hub - The AbstractLightEnergyHub to create or get an assembly for.
      Returns:
      A new instance of Assembly, or an existing instance of one already knows about this AbstractLightEnergyHub.

    • findAssemblyContainingNode

      @Nullable public static Assembly findAssemblyContainingNode(AbstractLightEnergyLink link)
      Similar to getAssemblyFor(AbstractLightEnergyHub), but this returns the assembly containing the given node. This will usually be more expensive, as assemblies have more nodes than hubs.
      Parameters:
      link - The node to search for.
      Returns:
      An Assembly containing the given AbstractLightEnergyLink, or null if no such assembly exists.

    • clearAllKnownAssemblies

      public static void clearAllKnownAssemblies(boolean client)
      This sets currentDebugID to 0 (to reset debug IDs) and clears the list of every instantiated assembly for this side from memory. Should only be executed when a world is unloading.
      Parameters:
      client - If true, the client list should be cleared. If false, the server (both dedicated and integrated apply) should be.

    • mergeWith

      public void mergeWith(Assembly other, AbstractLightEnergyLink cause)
      Assuming this assembly has just connected with the given other assembly, this merges the other assembly into this.
      Parameters:
      other - The other assembly that will be merged into this.
      cause - If this was caused by the addition of a link, this is the link that caused it.

    • fragment

      public Assembly[] fragment()
      Assuming this assembly has just been broken into more than one disconnected part, this will figure out where the break occurred, resize this assembly to what parts remain, and create a new assembly out of the parts that were disconnected.
      Returns:
      This assembly in index #0, and the new assembly from the disconnected parts in the remaining indices.

    • getLineContaining

      @Nullable public Line getLineContaining(AbstractLightEnergyLink conduit)
      Returns the Line that contains the given conduit, or null if no such line exists.
      Parameters:
      conduit - The conduit that is presumably a part of one of the lines in this assembly.
      Returns:
      The Line containing the given conduit, or null if no line in this assembly contains it.

    • handleLinkAddition

      public void handleLinkAddition(AbstractLightEnergyLink link)
      Handles a new conduit being added to this Assembly.
      Parameters:
      link - The conduit that was just added.

    • handleLinkRemoval

      public void handleLinkRemoval(AbstractLightEnergyLink link)
      Handles an existing conduit being removed from this Assembly.
      Parameters:
      link - The conduit that was just removed.

    • handleLinkConnectionStateChanged

      public void handleLinkConnectionStateChanged(AbstractLightEnergyLink link)
      Handles whenever the outgoing connections associated with this conduit change.
      Parameters:
      link - The conduit whose connection state changed.

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Returns whether or not this assembly has no hubs. In intended cases, this should always return true, and if it is returning false, then the reference to this assembly should be dropped immediately as it needs to be scheduled for GC.
      Returns:
      Whether or not this assembly has no hubs.

    • isFullyLoaded

      public boolean isFullyLoaded()
      Returns whether or not this assembly has fully loaded, or, all of its occupied chunks are loaded.
      Returns:
      Whether or not this assembly has fully loaded, or, all of its occupied chunks are loaded.

    • disconnectHub

      public void disconnectHub(AbstractLightEnergyHub hub)
      Disconnects the given hub from this Assembly, and disposes of this assembly if it has no more hubs after this is called.
      Parameters:
      hub - The hub to remove.

    • connectHub

      public void connectHub(AbstractLightEnergyHub hub)
      Connects the given hub to this Assembly.
      Parameters:
      hub - The hub to add.

    • isHubConnected

      public boolean isHubConnected(AbstractLightEnergyHub hub)
      Returns whether or not the given AbstractLightEnergyHub is part of this Assembly.
      Parameters:
      hub - The hub to check.
      Returns:
      Whether or not the given hub is part of this assembly.

    • getCore

      @Nullable public AbstractLightEnergyHub getCore()
      Returns the first anchor point for this assembly. This does not necessarily mean first sequentially, as it references the internal connected hub array and returns the first element.
      Returns:
      The first anchor point in this assembly, or null if this assembly does not have any roots (in which case this assembly should technically not even exist)

    • getHubs

      public List<AbstractLightEnergyHub> getHubs()
      Returns:
      All anchor points in this assembly. This is a snapshot list and is readonly.

    • getLines

      public List<Line> getLines()
      Returns:
      All lines that this assembly is composed of. This is a snapshot list and is readonly.

    • dispose

      public void dispose()
      Dispose of the data associated with this assembly. This is used when the assembly is being fully deleted.
